name: Shimla
description: Queen of Hills at 2,205m, British summer capital, colonial architecture, Mall Road, Ridge, Christ Church, toy train (UNESCO World Heritage), Jakhu Temple, pine forests.

name: The Ridge & Mall Road
description: Heart of Shimla, open space with Christ Church, Gaiety Theatre, Scandal Point, shopping, cafes, cultural events, Himalayan panoramic views, pedestrian zone.

name: Kufri
description: Winter sports destination at 2,743m, skiing, Himalayan Nature Park, Mahasu Peak, yak and pony rides, adventure activities, snow activities in winter.

name: Manali
description: Valley of Gods at 2,050m, adventure hub, Hadimba Temple, Old Manali, Vashisht hot springs, gateway to Rohtang Pass, honeymoon destination, Beas River, apple orchards.

name: Solang Valley
description: Adventure capital near Manali, paragliding, zorbing, skiing in winter, cable car, skiing slopes, snow activities, Solang Ropeway, stunning mountain scenery.

name: Rohtang Pass
description: High mountain pass at 3,978m, gateway to Lahaul-Spiti, snow activities, panoramic views, permits required, connects Kullu Valley to Lahaul Valley, seasonal opening.

name: Kasol
description: Mini Israel of India in Parvati Valley, backpacker hub, hippie culture, Israeli cafes, trekking to Kheerganga, Tosh village, riverside camping, Parvati River.

name: Parvati Valley
description: Mystical valley with Kasol, Manikaran hot springs, Tosh, Malana villages, trekking routes to Kheerganga, Pin Parvati Pass, hashish culture, scenic beauty.

name: Dharamshala
description: Seat of Tibetan government-in-exile at 1,457m, Dalai Lama residence, Tibetan culture, monasteries, cricket stadium with Dhauladhar backdrop, McLeod Ganj nearby.

name: McLeod Ganj
description: Little Lhasa, Tibetan refugee center, Dalai Lama Temple, Tsuglagkhang Complex, Tibetan Museum, cafes, monasteries, trekking to Triund, Buddhist philosophy courses.

name: Dalai Lama Temple
description: Tsuglagkhang Complex, official residence of Dalai Lama, Tibetan Buddhist temple, Namgyal Monastery, museum with Tibetan history, teachings and audiences with Dalai Lama.

name: Kangra Fort
description: Ancient fort dating back to Trigarta Kingdom, largest fort in Himalayas, damaged by 1905 earthquake, temples, panoramic Kangra Valley views, Beas-Banganga confluence.

name: Palampur
description: Tea Capital of North India at 1,220m, tea gardens, Dhauladhar mountain range backdrop, colonial heritage, Neugal Khad, Baijnath Temple, trekking base, Andretta pottery village.

name: Bir Billing
description: World's second-best paragliding site, Billing takeoff at 2,400m to Bir landing at 1,400m, Tibetan monasteries, meditation centers, paragliding capital of India.

name: Chamba
description: Ancient town on Ravi River at 996m, Lakshmi Narayan Temple complex, Chaugan (parade ground), Rang Mahal palace, Chamba Rumal embroidery, Minjar Fair, miniature paintings.

name: Khajjiar
description: Mini Switzerland of India at 1,920m, saucer-shaped meadow with lake, Khajji Nag Temple, deodar forests, adventure activities, zorbing, horse riding, serene beauty.

name: Dalhousie
description: Colonial hill station at 1,970m spread over five hills, Victorian architecture, St. John's Church, Panchpula waterfalls, Khajjiar nearby, pine and deodar forests, serene ambiance.

name: Spiti Valley
description: Cold desert mountain valley at 3,800m+, Middle Land between India and Tibet, ancient monasteries, Key, Tabo, Dhankar, Kaza town, high-altitude villages, Pin Valley, Chandratal Lake.

name: Key Monastery
description: Largest monastery in Spiti at 4,166m, 1000-year-old Tibetan Buddhist gompa, training center for lamas, hilltop fortress architecture, ancient murals, manuscripts, stunning valley views.

name: Tabo Monastery
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site (tentative), Ajanta of the Himalayas, 1000-year-old monastery founded 996 CE, ancient murals, stucco sculptures, Dalai Lama's Kalachakra initiation site.

name: Kalpa
description: Himalayan village at 2,960m with Kinner Kailash views, apple orchards, Buddhist and Hindu temples, suicide point, old Kalpa village, traditional Kinnauri architecture, Indo-Tibetan culture.

name: Sangla Valley
description: Baspa Valley with Sangla village at 2,680m, traditional Kinnauri houses, Kamru Fort, Bering Nag Temple, apple orchards, walnut trees, Baspa River, offbeat destination.

name: Chail
description: Tranquil hill station at 2,250m, world's highest cricket ground, Chail Palace (now hotel), Kali Ka Tibba temple, Chail Wildlife Sanctuary, panoramic views, alternative to crowded Shimla.

name: Great Himalayan National Park
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site, 1,171 sq km conservation area, snow leopards, Himalayan brown bears, blue sheep, 375+ fauna species, 180+ bird species, high-altitude trekking, biodiversity hotspot.

name: Pin Valley National Park
description: Cold desert national park at 3,500-6,000m, snow leopards, Siberian ibex, Tibetan gazelles, red fox, 80+ bird species, Pin River, Kungri Monastery, glaciers, high-altitude flora.

name: Nako Village
description: Picturesque village at 3,662m on Indo-Tibet border, Nako Lake, ancient Buddhist monastery with 1000-year-old murals, foot and handprints of Padmasambhava, remote Himalayan culture.

name: Kullu Dussehra Festival
description: International Kullu Dussehra, week-long celebration when Dussehra ends elsewhere, Lord Raghunath Rath Yatra, 200+ village deities procession, folk performances, unique cultural tradition since 1637.
